post.description: Adds a card on file to an existing customer.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description:
The value to provide in the Authorization header of
your request. This value should follow the format `Bearer YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN_HERE`.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
An object containing the fields to POST for the request.

See the corresponding object definition for field details.

post.description: Initiates a refund for a previously charged tender.

An object containing the fields to POST for the request.

get.description: Provides summary information for all of a business's locations.

parameters.description:
The value to provide in the Authorization header of
your request. This value should follow the format `Bearer YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN_HERE`.

post.description:
Make a one time use token (nonce) to return to the seller's site which is
separate and distinct from the card PAN. (Nonce is safe to persist, as it
is not a payment card, although it can only be used one time.)

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
An object containing the fields to POST for the request.

See the corresponding object definition for field details.

get.description:
Lists transactions for a particular location.

When making a request to this endpoint, your request body **must** include either the `cursor` parameter, or it must
include both `begin_time` and `end_time` with an optional `sort_order`.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description:
The value to provide in the Authorization header of
your request. This value should follow the format `Bearer YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN_HERE`.

parameters.name: location_id
parameters.description: The ID of the location to list transactions for.

parameters.name: begin_time
parameters.description: The beginning of the requested reporting period, in RFC 3339 format.

parameters.name: end_time
parameters.description: The end of the requested reporting period, in RFC 3339 format.

parameters.name: sort_order
parameters.description:
The order in which results are listed in the response (`ASC` for
chronological, `DESC` for reverse-chronological).

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description:
A pagination cursor to retrieve the next set of results for your
original query to the endpoint.

parameters.name: sort_order
parameters.description: The order in which results are listed in the response.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description:
A pagination cursor to retrieve the next set of results for your
original query to the endpoint.

DeleteCustomerCardResponse.description:
Defines the fields that are included in the response body of
a request to the **DeleteCustomerCard** endpoint.

ListRefundsRequest.description:
Defines the query parameters that can be included in
a request to the **ListRefunds** endpoint.

cursor.description:
A pagination cursor to retrieve the next set of results for your
original query to the endpoint.

end_time.description: The end of the requested reporting period, in RFC 3339 format.

begin_time.description: The beginning of the requested reporting period, in RFC 3339 format.

sort_order.description: The order in which results are listed in the response.

cards.description: Cards on file for the customer.

created_at.description: The time when the customer was created, in RFC 3339 format.

updated_at.description: The time when the customer was updated, in RFC 3339 format.

CreateCustomerCardResponse.description:
Defines the fields that are included in the response body of
a request to the **CreateCustomerCard** endpoint.

One of `errors` or `card` is present in a given response (never both).

RetrieveTransactionResponse.description:
Defines the fields that are included in the response body of
a request to the **RetrieveTransaction** endpoint.

One of `errors` or `transaction` is present in a given response (never both).

errors.description: Any errors that occurred during the request.

transaction.description: The details of the requested transaction.

VoidTransactionResponse.description:
Defines the fields that are included in the response body of
a request to the **CaptureTransaction** endpoint.

errors.description: Any errors that occurred during the request.

card_nonce.description: A card nonce representing the card data to link to the customer.

billing_address.description: Postal code in the address is required for US and Canada payments.

CaptureTransactionResponse.description:
Defines the fields that are included in the response body of
a request to the **CaptureTransaction** endpoint.

errors.description: Any errors that occurred during the request.

TenderCardDetails.description: Represents the details of a credit card tender.

status.description: The credit card payment's current state (such as `CAPTURED`)

UpdateCustomerResponse.description:
Defines the fields that are included in the response body of
a request to the **UpdateCustomer** endpoint.

One of `errors` or `customer` is present in a given response (never both).

amount.description:
Amount in the lowest denominated value of this Currency. E.g. in USD
these are cents, in JPY they are Yen (which do not have a 'cent' concept).

card_nonce.description: card nonce result. One time use token that represents this card data.

ListTransactionsRequest.description:
Defines the query parameters that can be included in
a request to the **ListTransactions** endpoint.

cursor.description:
A pagination cursor to retrieve the next set of results for your
original query to the endpoint.

end_time.description: The end of the requested reporting period, in RFC 3339 format.

begin_time.description: The beginning of the requested reporting period, in RFC 3339 format.

sort_order.description:
The order in which results are listed in the response (`ASC` for
chronological, `DESC` for reverse-chronological).

ListCustomersResponse.description:
Defines the fields that are included in the response body of
a request to the **ListCustomers** endpoint.

One of `errors` or `customers` is present in a given response (never both).

card_data.description: Billing address in the card data is not required for card nonce creation.

CreateRefundRequest.description:
Defines the body parameters that can be included in
a request to the **CreateRefund** endpoint.

reason.description: A description of the reason for the refund.

idempotency_key.description:
A value you specify that uniquely identifies this
refund among refunds you've created for the tender.

If you're unsure whether a particular refund succeeded,
you can reattempt it with the same idempotency key without
worrying about duplicating the refund.

tender_id.description: The ID of the tender to refund.

amount_money.description: The amount of money to refund.

CreateRefundResponse.description:
Defines the fields that are included in the response body of
a request to the **CreateRefund** endpoint.

One of `errors` or `refund` is present in a given response (never both).

errors.description: Any errors that occurred during the request.

refund.description: The details of the created refund.

ChargeRequest.description:
Defines the parameters that can be included in the body of
a request to the **Charge** endpoint.

delay_capture.description:
If `true`, the request will only perform an Auth on the provided
card. You can then later perform either a Capture (with the
*CaptureTransaction** endpoint) or a Void (with the **VoidTransation**
endpoint.

note.description: An optional note to associate with the transaction.

reference_id.description:
An optional ID you can associate with the transaction for your own
purposes (such as to associate the transaction with an entity ID in your
own database).

customer_card_id.description:
The ID of the customer card on file to charge for this transaction. Do
not provide a value for this field if you provide a value for `card_nonce`.

card_nonce.description:
A nonce representing the credit card to charge for this transaction.
Do not provide a value for this field if you provide a value for
`customer_card_id`.

idempotency_key.description:
A value you specify that uniquely identifies this
transaction among transactions you've created.

If you're unsure whether a particular transaction succeeded,
you can reattempt it with the same idempotency key without
worrying about double-charging the buyer. Note that *all other fields*
must also remain identical in your followup request, or an error will occur.

amount_money.description: The amount of money to collect in the transaction.

billing_address.description: If available, Postal code in the billing address for US and Canada payments may reduce decline rate.

customer_id.description:
The ID of the customer to associate this transaction with. This field
is required if you provide a value for `customer_card_id`, and optional
otherwise.

ListLocationsResponse.description:
Defines the fields that are included in the response body of 
a request to the **ListLocations** endpoint.

One of `errors` or `locations` is present in a given response (never both).

locations.description: An array of the business's locations.

errors.description: Any errors that occurred during the request.

Tender.description: Represents a form of tender used to pay in a transaction.

transaction_id.description: The ID of the tender's associated transaction.

card_details.description:
The details of the card tender.

This value is present only if the value of `type` is `CARD`.

note.description: An optional note associated with the tender at the time of payment.

created_at.description: The time when the tender was created, in RFC 3339 format.

customer_id.description:
If the tender represents a customer's card on file, this is
the ID of the associated customer.

processing_fee_money.description: The amount of any Square processing fees applied to the tender.

location_id.description: The ID of the tender's associated location.

last_4.description: The last 4 digits of the card's number.

exp_month.description: The month of the card's expiration date, which must be between 1-12.

billing_address.description: The billing address for the card on file.

id.description: The card's unique ID, if any.

exp_year.description: The year of the card's expiration date, which must be a 4-digit year.

cardholder_name.description: The cardholder name for the card on file.

cvv.description: The card verification value (i.e. security code) printed on the card.

billing_postal_code.description: The billing postal code for the card on file.

exp_month.description: The month of the card's expiration date, which must be between 1-12.

exp_year.description: The year of the card's expiration date, which must be a 4 digit year.

ListTransactionsResponse.description:
Defines the fields that are included in the response body of
a request to the **ListTransactions** endpoint.

One of `errors` or `transactions` is present in a given response (never both).

cursor.description:
A pagination cursor for retrieving the next set of results,
if any remain.

Provide this value as the `cursor` parameter in a subsequent request
to the **ListTransactions** endpoint.

transactions.description: An array of transactions that match your query.

errors.description: Any errors that occurred during the request.

transaction_id.description: The ID of the transaction refunded.

reason.description: The reason for the refund being issued.

tender_id.description: The ID of the tender refunded.

created_at.description: The time when the refund was created, in RFC 3339 format.

id.description: The unique ID of the refund.

processing_fee_money.description: The amount of processing fee refunded.

location_id.description: The ID of the refund's associated location.

Transaction.description:
Represents a transaction processed with Square, either with the
Connect API or with Square Register.

reference_id.description:
If the transaction was created with the **Charge** endpoint, this
value is the same as the value provided as the `reference_id` parameter
in the request to that endpoint.

tenders.description: Descriptions of the tenders used to pay for the transaction.

created_at.description: The time when the transaction was created, in RFC 3339 format.

location_id.description: The ID of the transaction's associated location.

refunds.description: An array of any refunds associated with the transaction.

DeleteCustomerResponse.description:
Defines the fields that are included in the response body of
a request to the **DeleteCustomer** endpoint.

RetrieveCustomerResponse.description:
Defines the fields that are included in the response body of
a request to the **RetrieveCustomer** endpoint.

One of `errors` or `customer` is present in a given response (never both).

ListRefundsResponse.description:
Defines the fields that are included in the response body of
a request to the **ListTenderRefunds** endpoint.

One of `errors` or `refunds` is present in a given response (never both).

cursor.description:
A pagination cursor for retrieving the next set of results,
if any remain.

Provide this value as the `cursor` parameter in a subsequent request
to the **ListTenderRefunds** endpoint.

errors.description: Any errors that occurred during the request.

refunds.description: An array of refunds that match your query.

ChargeResponse.description:
Defines the fields that are included in the response body of
a request to the **Charge** endpoint.

One of `errors` or `transaction` is present in a given response (never both).

errors.description: Any errors that occurred during the request.

transaction.description: The details of the created transaction.

CreateCustomerResponse.description:
Defines the fields that are included in the response body of
a request to the **CreateCustomer** endpoint.

One of `errors` or `customer` is present in a given response (never both).

Location.description: Represents one of a business's locations.

capabilities.description:
Indicates which Square features are enabled for the location.

Currently, there is only one value that might be present in this array:
`CREDIT_CARD_PROCESSING`.

timezone.description: The IANA Timezone Database identifier for the location's timezone.

name.description: The name given to the location.
